title: Suspicious Explorer Process with Whitespace Padding
description: Detects a known 2025/2026 technique (ClickFix/FileFix) where 'explorer.exe' is launched with extra spaces to evade simple command-line filters.
code:
logsource:
    category: process_creation
    product: windows
detection:
    selection:
        Image|endswith: '\explorer.exe'
        CommandLine|contains: '   '
    condition: selection
level: high
author: SigmaHQ

title: 2026 AI-Generated Phishing HTML
description: Detects structural patterns common in high-fidelity phishing kits seen in early 2026 that use AI to bypass standard keyword filters.
code:
rule AI_Phish_Kit_2026 {
    meta:
        description = "Detects advanced 2026 phishing structures"
        author = "ThreatNet Ops"
    strings:
        $obf1 = /<script>eval\(atob\(['"]/ 
        $css1 = "display: none; visibility: hidden;" 
        $hook = "rest/v1/auth/login"
    condition:
        2 of them
}
author: Community

title: Kerberoasting via RC4 TGS Floods
description: Detects Silent Kerberoasting attempts using weak RC4 encryption.
code:
logsource:
    product: windows
    service: security
detection:
    selection:
        EventID: 4769
        TicketOptions: '0x40810000'
        TicketEncryptionType: '0x17'
    condition: selection
level: medium
author: SEC4U

title: Mshta Executing Remote Script
description: Detects mshta.exe executing remote payloads, a common malware loader technique.
code:
logsource:
    category: process_creation
    product: windows
detection:
    selection:
        Image|endswith: '\mshta.exe'
        CommandLine|contains:
            - 'http'
            - 'https'
    condition: selection
level: high
author: ThreatNet Ops

title: PowerShell Encoded Command Execution
description: Detects PowerShell executions using Base64-encoded commands.
code:
logsource:
    category: process_creation
    product: windows
detection:
    selection:
        Image|endswith: '\powershell.exe'
        CommandLine|contains:
            - '-enc'
            - '-encodedcommand'
    condition: selection
level: high
author: SigmaHQ

title: Cloud Admin API Token Used from New ASN
description: Detects suspicious cloud admin token usage from new ASNs.
code:
logsource:
    category: cloud
    product: generic
detection:
    selection:
        role: 'admin'
    condition: selection
level: high
author: Community

title: Linux Cron Persistence Backdoor
description: Detects malicious cron jobs used for persistence.
code:
rule Linux_Cron_Backdoor {
    meta:
        description = "Detects cron-based persistence backdoors"
        author = "Community"
    strings:
        $cron1 = "* * * * *" 
        $curl = "curl -s" nocase
        $wget = "wget -q" nocase
        $pipe = "| sh" nocase
    condition:
        2 of them
}
author: Community

title: Ransomware Pre-Encryption Shadow Copy Deletion
description: Detects shadow copy deletion commonly executed by ransomware.
code:
logsource:
    category: process_creation
    product: windows
detection:
    selection:
        CommandLine|contains:
            - 'vssadmin delete shadows'
            - 'wmic shadowcopy delete'
            - 'bcdedit /set {default} recoveryenabled no'
    condition: selection
level: critical
author: SigmaHQ

title: Linux Ransomware ELF Payload
description: Detects Linux ransomware payloads.
author: Community

title: Ransomware Shadow Copy and Recovery Deletion
description: Detects commands commonly executed by ransomware to remove backups and disable recovery before encryption.
code:
logsource:
    category: process_creation
    product: windows
detection:
    selection:
        CommandLine|contains:
            - 'vssadmin delete shadows'
            - 'wmic shadowcopy delete'
            - 'bcdedit /set {default} recoveryenabled no'
            - 'bcdedit /set {default} bootstatuspolicy ignoreallfailures'
    condition: selection
level: critical
author: SigmaHQ

title: Linux and ESXi Ransomware VM Termination
description: Detects ESXi-focused ransomware stopping virtual machines prior to encryption.
code:
logsource:
    category: process_creation
    product: linux
detection:
    selection:
        CommandLine|contains:
            - 'esxcli vm process kill'
            - 'vim-cmd vmsvc/power.off'
    condition: selection
level: critical
author: Community

title: PowerShell Encoded Malware Execution
description: Detects obfuscated PowerShell execution commonly used by modern malware loaders.
code:
logsource:
    category: process_creation
    product: windows
detection:
    selection:
        Image|endswith: '\powershell.exe'
        CommandLine|contains:
            - '-enc'
            - '-encodedcommand'
    condition: selection
level: high
author: SigmaHQ

title: LSASS Credential Dump Attempt
description: Detects access to LSASS memory, a strong indicator of credential dumping by malware or ransomware operators.
code:
logsource:
    category: process_access
    product: windows
detection:
    selection:
        TargetImage|endswith: '\lsass.exe'
    condition: selection
level: high
author: SigmaHQ

title: Suspicious PsExec Lateral Movement
description: Detects use of PsExec for lateral movement, commonly seen in ransomware intrusions.
code:
logsource:
    category: process_creation
    product: windows
detection:
    selection:
        Image|endswith: '\psexec.exe'
    condition: selection
level: high
author: Community

title: Registry Run Key Persistence
description: Detects malware establishing persistence via Windows Run registry keys.
code:
logsource:
    category: registry_event
    product: windows
detection:
    selection:
        TargetObject|contains: 'CurrentVersion\\Run'
    condition: selection
level: medium
author: SigmaHQ

title: Suspicious Data Exfiltration via Curl
description: Detects potential data exfiltration using curl to external servers.
code:
logsource:
    category: process_creation
    product: linux
detection:
    selection:
        Image|endswith: '/curl'
        CommandLine|contains:
            - '-X POST'
            - '--data'
    condition: selection
level: high
author: Community

title: Generic Ransomware Encryption Routine
description: Detects hybrid AES/RSA encryption logic common across modern ransomware families.
code:
rule Ransomware_Generic_Encrypt_2026 {
    meta:
        description = "Generic ransomware encryption detection"
        author = "ThreatNet Ops"
    strings:
        $aes = "AES_encrypt" nocase
        $rsa = "RSA_public_encrypt" nocase
        $note = "YOUR FILES HAVE BEEN ENCRYPTED" nocase
    condition:
        2 of them
}
author: ThreatNet Ops

title: AI Obfuscated Malware Loader
description: Detects malware loaders using AI-generated variable entropy and runtime decoding.
code:
rule AI_Malware_Loader_2026 {
    meta:
        description = "AI-assisted malware loader detection"
        author = "ThreatNet Ops"
    strings:
        $entropy = /var [a-zA-Z]{25,40} = \[/
        $decode = "String.fromCharCode" nocase
        $eval = "eval(" nocase
    condition:
        filesize < 400KB and 2 of them
}
author: ThreatNet Ops

title: AiLock Ransomware Detection
description: Detection rule for AiLock Ransomware using file markers and distinctive strings.
code:
rule CyberCrime_AiLock_AiLockRansomware {
    meta:
        description = "Detection rule for AiLock Ransomware"
        author = "gmrdkd@s2w.inc"
        created_at = "2025-04-03"
        version = "v1.0"
        threat_actor = "AiLock"
        category = "Malware"
        malware_name = "AiLock Ransomware"
        severity = "High"
        hash1 = "2a728d98ae8280efeaa674783181f3fa"
    strings:
        $string1 = ".AiLock" ascii wide nocase
        $string2 = "Start Log:%d Network:%d Selfdelete:%d Path=%s" ascii wide nocase
        $string3 = "Total time of encryption: %llu seconds" ascii wide nocase
        $string4 = "read=%u kbytes, write=%u kbytes, opened=%u, encPS=%u, totalFound=%u, TotalEncrypted=%u" ascii wide nocase
        $string5 = "Single instance only Exit" ascii wide nocase
        $marker1 = {BE BA AD AB}
        $marker2 = {B5 00 6B B1}
        $marker3 = {00 B5 B1 6B}
        $marker4 = {DE AD BA BE}
        $marker5 = {BA BE DE AD}
    condition:
        uint16(0) == 0x5A4D
        and all of ($marker*)
        and 2 of ($string*)
}
author: gmrdkd@s2w.inc

title: Akira Ransomware Windows Payload
description: Detects Akira ransomware Windows payload through characteristic strings and patterns.
code:
rule Akira {
    meta:
        author = "rivitna"
        family = "ransomware.akira.windows"
        description = "Akira ransomware Windows payload"
        severity = 10
        score = 100
    strings:
        $s0 = "\x00--encryption_path\x00" ascii wide
        $s1 = "\x00--share_file\x00" ascii wide
        $s2 = "\x00--encryption_percent\x00" ascii wide
        $s3 = "\x00-fork\x00" ascii
        $s4 = "\x00-localonly\x00" ascii wide
        $s5 = "\x00Failed to read share files\x00" ascii wide
        $s6 = ":\\akira\\asio\\include\\" ascii
        $s7 = "\x00write_encrypt_info error: \x00" ascii
        $s8 = "\x00encrypt_part error: \x00" ascii
        $s9 = "\x00Detected number of cpus = \x00" ascii
        $s10 = "\x00No path to encrypt\x00" ascii
        $s11 = "Paste this link - https://akira" ascii
        $s12 = "\x00Trend Micro\x00" wide
        $s13 = "Failed to make full encrypt" ascii wide
        $s14 = "Failed to make spot encrypt" ascii wide
        $s15 = "Failed to make part encrypt" ascii wide
        $s16 = "Failed to write header" ascii wide
        $s17 = "file rename failed. System error:" ascii wide
        $s18 = "Number of thread to folder parsers = \x00" ascii
        $s19 = "Number of threads to encrypt = \x00" ascii
        $s20 = "Number of thread to root folder parsers = \x00" ascii
        $s21 = "Failed to read share files!\x00" ascii
    condition:
        uint16(0) == 0x5A4D and 7 of ($s*)
}
author: rivitna

title: BlackCat Ransomware Windows Detection
description: Detects the BlackCat (ALPHV) ransomware Windows version using characteristic strings.
code:
rule ransomware_win_blackcat {
    meta:
        id = "873355f7-3942-4171-9df7-f524bb6b6903"
        description = "Detect the BlackCat ransomware (Windows version)"
        author = "Sekoia.io"
        creation_date = "2022-01-19"
        classification = "TLP:CLEAR"
        version = "1.1"
    strings:
        $s1 = "desktop_image::set_desktop_wallpaper=" ascii
        $s2 = "C:\\Users\\Public\\All Usersdeploy_note_and_image_for_all_users=" ascii
        $s3 = "propagate::none" ascii
        $s4 = "propagate::failed=" ascii
        $s5 = "propagate::ok=" ascii
        $s6 = "query_status_process::ok=" ascii
        $s7 = "enum_dependent_services::ok=" ascii
        $s8 = "enum_dependent_services::error=" ascii
        $s9 = "try_stop=" ascii
        $s10 = "try_stop::ok=" ascii
        $s11 = "try_stop::failed=" ascii
        $s12 = "stop=" ascii
        $s13 = "dependent_service_name=" ascii
        $s14 = "kill_all=" ascii
        $s15 = "detach=" ascii
    condition:
        uint16(0)==0x5A4D
        and filesize > 2MB and filesize < 4MB
        and all of them
}
author: Sekoia.io

title: AvosLocker Ransomware Detection
description: Detects AvosLocker ransomware through cryptopp library references.
code:
rule ransomware_win_avoslocker {
    meta:
        id = "fc5c2483-48cb-4282-b6cb-ac728b948607"
        version = "1.0"
        description = "Detect AvosLocker ransomware (2021-07)"
        author = "Sekoia.io"
        creation_date = "2021-08-03"
        classification = "TLP:CLEAR"
        hash6 = "f810deb1ba171cea5b595c6d3f816127fb182833f7a08a98de93226d4f6a336f"
        hash7 = "c0a42741eef72991d9d0ee8b6c0531fc19151457a8b59bdcf7b6373d1fe56e02"
        hash8 = "84d94c032543e8797a514323b0b8fd8bd69b4183f17351628b13d1464093af2d"
    strings:
        $s1 = "cryptopp850\\rijndael_simd.cpp" ascii
        $s2 = "cryptopp850\\sha_simd.cpp" ascii
        $s3 = "cryptopp850\\gf2n_simd.cpp" ascii
        $s4 = "cryptopp850\\sse_simd.cpp" ascii
    condition:
        all of them
        and uint16(0)==0x5A4D
        and filesize > 900KB
        and filesize < 950KB
}
author: Sekoia.io

title: Babuk ESXi Ransomware
description: Detects Babuk ransomware targeting ESXi environments.
code:
rule Babuk_ESXi {
    meta:
        author = "rivitna"
        family = "ransomware.babuk.esxi"
        description = "Babuk ESXi"
        severity = 10
        score = 100
    strings:
        $h0 = "/dev/urandom\x00" ascii
        $h1 = "EiB\x00PiB\x00TiB\x00GiB\x00MiB\x00KiB\x00B\x00" ascii
        $h2 = "crypting: %s\n\x00" ascii
        $c0 = { 67 E6 09 6A [2-8] 85 AE 67 BB [2-8] 72 F3 6E 3C [2-8]
                3A F5 4F A5 [2-8] 7F 52 0E 51 [2-8] 8C 68 05 9B }
        $c1 = { 98 2F 8A 42 91 44 37 71 CF FB C0 B5 A5 DB B5 E9
                5B C2 56 39 F1 11 F1 59 A4 82 3F 92 D5 5E 1C AB }
        $c2 = { 79 37 9E 89 [4-16] C1 C? ( 15 | 0B ) [16-40] 79 37 9E 89 }
    condition:
        (uint32(0) == 0x464C457F) and (filesize < 120000) and
        (all of ($c*)) and (1 of ($h*))
}
author: rivitna

title: Babuk Ransomware v3
description: Detects Babuk Ransomware version 3 through characteristic strings and parameters.
code:
rule BabukRansomwareV3 {
    meta:
        description = "YARA rule for Babuk Ransomware v3"
        reference = "http://chuongdong.com/reverse engineering/2021/01/16/BabukRansomware-v3/"
        author = "@cPeterr"
        date = "2021-01-16"
        rule_version = "v3"
        malware_type = "ransomware"
        tlp = "white"
    strings:
        $lanstr1 = "-lanfirst"
        $lanstr2 = "-nolan"
        $lanstr3 = "shares"
        $str1 = "BABUK LOCKER"
        $str2 = "babukq4e2p4wu4iq.onion"
        $str3 = "How To Restore Your Files.txt" wide
        $str4 = "babuk_v3"
        $str5 = ".babyk" wide
    condition:
        all of ($str*) and all of ($lanstr*)
}
author: @cPeterr

title: Beast Ransomware Windows
description: Detects Beast ransomware Windows payload through hex patterns.
author: rivitna

title: BlackByte Ransomware
description: Detects BlackByte ransomware through Go-based string patterns.
code:
rule BlackByte {
    meta:
        author = "rivitna"
        family = "ransomware.hive"
        description = "BlackByte ransomware Windows payload"
        severity = 10
        score = 100
    strings:
        $h0 = { 83 E? 05 48 83 C? 01 88 4? FF 4? 39 ?? (74 | 75) ?? }
        $s0 = "\x00main.RSA\x00" ascii
        $s1 = "\x00main._Cfunc_Begin\x00" ascii
        $s2 = "\x00main._Cfunc_Inj\x00" ascii
        $s3 = "\x00main.Inja" ascii
        $s4 = "\x00main.SetWinVer\x00" ascii
        $s5 = "\x00main.DelShadows" ascii
        $s6 = "\x00main.StartNetworkS" ascii
        $s7 = "\x00main.EnableLink" ascii
        $s8 = "\x00main.EnableLongPaths" ascii
        $s9 = "\x00main.GrantAll" ascii
        $s10 = "\x00main.LanScan" ascii
        $s11 = "\x00main.SetupKey\x00" ascii
        $s12 = "\x00main.PbKey\x00" ascii
        $s13 = "\x00main.Pognali" ascii
        $s14 = "\x00main.ShowNote" ascii
        $s15 = "\x00main.MountDrives" ascii
        $s16 = "\x00main.StopAllsvc" ascii
        $s17 = "\x00main.GenDrives" ascii
        $s18 = "\x00main.ParsePC" ascii
        $s19 = "\x00main.GetAccess" ascii
        $s20 = "\x00main.KillHypers" ascii
        $s21 = "\x00main.ParseHypers" ascii
        $s22 = "\x00main.Aes256Encr\x00" ascii
        $s23 = "\x00main.Aes256Decr\x00" ascii
    condition:
        uint16(0) == 0x5A4D and (1 of ($h*) or 4 of ($s*))
}
author: rivitna

title: Conti Ransomware v2/v3
description: Detects Conti ransomware versions 2 and 3 through hex patterns.
author: rivitna

title: DarkSide Ransomware Linux
description: Detects DarkSide ransomware Linux version.
code:
rule Darkside_linux {
    meta:
        description = "darkside ransomware linux version"
        author = "Alienvault Labs"
        copyright = "Alienvault Inc. 2021"
    strings:
        $s1 = "[END] Remove Self"
        $s2 = "[CFG] Landing URL#["
        $s3 = "Welcome to DarkSide"
        $dec_loop = { 0F B6 02 84 C0 74 1C 0F B6 B1 DF A7 89 00 40 38 F0 74 10 48 83 C1 01 31 F0 48 83 F9 20 88 02 49 0F 44 C8 }
    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and all of them
}
author: Alienvault Labs

title: Qilin Ransomware Loader
description: Detects Qilin ransomware Windows loader with large .rdata section.
code:
import "pe"
rule Qilin_Loader {
    meta:
        author = "rivitna"
        family = "ransomware.qilin.windows"
        description = "Qilin ransomware Windows loader"
        severity = 10
        score = 100
    strings:
        $h0 = { 85 C0 75 12 E8 [4] 85 C0 0F 84 ?? 0? 00 00 A3 [4]
                68 00 ?? ( 2? | 3? | 4? ) 00 6A 00 50 E8 [4] 85 C0
                0F 84 ?? 0? 00 00 31 D2 BF 00 [2] FF ( BB | 8D ) [0-8]
                ( 89 44 24 ?? C7 44 24 ?? ?0 ?? ?? 00
                  C7 44 24 ?? 00 00 00 00 |
                  ( 89 45 ?? C7 45 ?? ?0 ?? ?? 00 |
                    C7 45 ?? ?0 ?? ?? 00 89 45 ?? )
                  C7 45 ?? 00 00 00 00 )
                EB }
    condition:
        uint16(0) == 0x5A4D
        and for any i in (0..pe.number_of_sections-1):
        (
            (pe.sections[i].raw_data_size >= 0x2A0000)
            and (pe.sections[i].raw_data_size <= 0x500000)
            and (pe.sections[i].name == ".rdata")
        )
        and 1 of ($h*)
}
author: rivitna

title: Qilin Ransomware ESXi
description: Detects Qilin ransomware targeting ESXi servers.
code:
rule QilinRansomwareESXi {
    meta:
        description = "rule to detect Qilin Ransomware"
        author = "ShadowStackRe.com"
        date = "2023-12-06"
        Rule_Version = "v1"
        malware_type = "ransomware"
        malware_family = "Qilin"
        License = "MIT License, https://opensource.org/license/mit/"
    strings:
        $strMotd = "/etc/motd"
        $strEncryptQuestion = "Are you sure to start encryption"
        $strConfigStart = "--- Configuration start ---"
        $strEsxiUsage = "esxcli"
        $strEncryptRenameFail = "Failed to rename encrypted file to"
        $strStartJob = "Started job..."
        $strBug = "\x1B[%uG 100%%"
    condition:
        all of them
}
author: ShadowStackRe.com

title: LockBit 3.0 / BlackMatter Ransomware
description: Detects LockBit 3.0 and BlackMatter ransomware Windows payload.
author: rivitna

title: LockBit Metasploit HTA Stager Detection
description: Detects Metasploit HTA stager used in LockBit campaigns.
code:
logsource:
    category: file_event
    product: windows
detection:
    selection:
        TargetFilename|endswith: '.hta'
        FileContent|contains:
            - 'CreateObject("Wscript.Shell")'
            - 'ExpandEnvironmentStrings("%PSModulePath%")'
            - 'powershell.exe -nop -w hidden -e'
    condition: selection
level: high
author: The DFIR Report

title: BlackBasta Ransomware
description: Auto-generated detection for BlackBasta ransomware using code sequences.
code:
rule win_blackbasta_auto {
    meta:
        author = "Felix Bilstein - yara-signator at cocacoding dot com"
        date = "2023-07-11"
        version = "1"
        description = "Detects win.blackbasta."
        info = "autogenerated rule brought to you by yara-signator"
        tool = "yara-signator v0.6.0"
        malpedia_reference = "https://malpedia.caad.fkie.fraunhofer.de/details/win.blackbasta"
        malpedia_license = "CC BY-SA 4.0"
    strings:
        $sequence_0 = { b8ffffff7f 8bd1 d1ea 2bc2 57 3bc8 7607 }
        $sequence_1 = { 6800000080 ff15???????? 85c0 754d 837d1c08 8d4d08 }
    condition:
        7 of them and filesize < 1758208
}
author: Felix Bilstein

title: Clop Ransomware
description: Auto-generated detection for Clop ransomware using code sequences.
code:
rule win_clop_auto {

        author = "Felix Bilstein - yara-signator at cocacoding dot com"
        date = "2023-07-11"
        version = "1"
        description = "Detects win.clop."
        info = "autogenerated rule brought to you by yara-signator"

        malpedia_license = "CC BY-SA 4.0"
    strings:
        $sequence_0 = { 6a04 6800300000 6887000000 6a00 }
        $sequence_1 = { 83c40c 6860070000 6a40 ff15???????? }
    condition:
        7 of them and filesize < 796672
}
author: Felix Bilstein
